title: Lab Equipment Maintenance Scheduler & Compliance Tracker
description: A simple web tool for academic research lab managers to input equipment details, upload maintenance manuals, and receive automated recurring maintenance task schedules with reminders to ensure timely compliance and reduce equipment downtime.
inputLabel: Enter your lab equipment details and upload maintenance manuals
outputLabel: Generated maintenance schedule and compliance task reminders
systemPrompt: You are a helpful assistant specialized in academic research lab equipment maintenance scheduling and compliance tracking. For given equipment details and uploaded maintenance manuals, generate a clear, personalized recurring maintenance task schedule, including calibration, safety checks, and inspection reminders. Enforce strict input validation: equipment must include ID, name, category, and a positive maintenance interval. Manuals must be valid PDF files or URLs. Output a plain text maintenance calendar with task due dates and notes. Reject any requests with disallowed content or missing required fields. Do not provide legal or medical advice. Always ensure user data confidentiality. Respond only with the requested maintenance schedule and task list, no extraneous commentary.

presets.label: Basic Maintenance Schedule
presets.prompt: Generate a recurring maintenance schedule for the provided lab equipment list with uploaded maintenance manuals. Include task types, due dates, and reminder notes.

presets.label: Compliance Task Reminder List
presets.prompt: From the provided equipment details and manuals, create a compliance checklist with upcoming and overdue tasks highlighted, suitable for audit preparation.

presets.label: Detailed Maintenance Log Template
presets.prompt: Using the input equipment information and maintenance guidelines, generate a detailed maintenance log structure including task history fields and notes.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured-output is enabled, output JSON with fields: equipmentId, taskType, scheduledDate (ISO 8601 string), reminderNotes.
clarifyPrompt: Please provide complete equipment details including unique ID, name, category, and maintenance interval. Upload maintenance manuals as PDFs or provide valid URLs. If unsure, specify the types of maintenance tasks you want scheduled.
finalizePrompt: Review the generated maintenance schedule and confirm if it meets your lab's compliance requirements. Request adjustments or additional reports if needed.

idea.workingTitle: Research Lab Equipment Maintenance Scheduler & Compliance Tracker

niche.scenario: Managing routine maintenance schedules and compliance documentation for diverse lab equipment to ensure operational safety, reliability, and regulatory adherence.

idea.problem: Lab managers struggle to track and schedule recurring maintenance tasks, calibration, safety inspections, and compliance reporting for a wide variety of research equipment. Current manual or spreadsheet-based systems cause missed maintenance, unclear compliance status, and inefficient documentation retrieval, risking equipment downtime and regulatory noncompliance.
inputs: List of lab equipment with specifications and maintenance requirements
Manufacturer maintenance manuals or guidelines (uploaded PDFs or links)
Lab usage logs or operational notes
Maintenance task completion records and timestamps
outputs: Personalized, automated recurring maintenance calendar and task reminders
Compliance status dashboards with overdue and upcoming tasks highlighted
Structured maintenance logs with detailed task histories per equipment
Actionable alerts for upcoming calibration, safety checks, or inspections
Exportable compliance reports for institutional audits or regulatory bodies
whyItWins: Addresses a critical but underserved operational workflow specific to academic labs, distinct from research data or protocol tools.
Combines task scheduling, compliance tracking, and documentation in one integrated system, reducing fragmentation.
Automates recurring maintenance reminders and compliance alerts, reducing human error and risk.
Supports uploading equipment manuals and guidelines to customize maintenance schedules dynamically.
Scales from a lightweight scheduling tool to a comprehensive, multi-equipment lab management system.

upgradePath.today: Simple web tool allowing lab managers to input equipment lists, upload maintenance instructions, and receive automated maintenance task schedules with email reminders.
upgradePath.in90Days: Add interactive compliance dashboards, detailed task logging, document management (manuals, checklists), and mobile notifications for maintenance teams.
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a full multi-user lab equipment management system with role-based access, integration with institutional asset management, real-time usage analytics, predictive maintenance suggestions, and compliance audit report generation.

riskNotes: Does not provide medical or legal advice, only operational scheduling and compliance assistance.
Relies on user-provided maintenance and regulatory data; accuracy depends on input quality.
Must ensure secure handling of institutional compliance and equipment data to protect confidentiality.

blueprint.summary: A comprehensive system for academic research lab managers to schedule, track, and document maintenance and compliance of lab equipment, integrating task automation, compliance dashboards, document management, and reporting.
successMetrics: Reduction in missed or overdue maintenance tasks
User adoption rate among lab managers and maintenance teams
Reduction in equipment downtime due to maintenance issues
Timely generation and export of compliance reports

backgroundJobs.name: Daily Maintenance Task Reminder
backgroundJobs.purpose: Evaluate upcoming and overdue maintenance tasks and send reminders/alerts to assigned users

edgeCases: Handling equipment with irregular or manufacturer-customized maintenance schedules
Users uploading incorrect or incomplete maintenance manuals impacting task generation
Network or service failures delaying reminder notifications
Multiple users updating the same maintenance task concurrently
Compliance checklist updates requiring retroactive task adjustments
Handling equipment decommissioning or replacement mid-cycle
Data privacy and access control breaches exposing sensitive compliance data
nonGoals: Providing medical, legal, or regulatory advice beyond operational scheduling
Direct integration with lab experimental data or research protocols
Real-time sensor-based predictive maintenance (planned for future upgrades)
Full institutional asset management beyond lab equipment scope

dataFlow: User accesses /equipment page and submits equipment details and manuals -> Equipment Management UI sends POST /api/equipment with equipment data and files -> api-equipment validates and persists data in data-equipment and data-documents stores.
User views equipment list on /equipment page -> Equipment Management UI calls GET /api/equipment with optional filters -> api-equipment fetches from data-equipment and returns equipment array.

Maintenance dashboard on /dashboard fetches maintenance tasks, compliance status, and reports data by calling GET /api/tasks, GET /api/compliance/status, and reporting APIs -> APIs query data-tasks, data-compliance, and data-equipment accordingly and return aggregated data for UI visualization.
User updates maintenance task completion on /tasks page -> UI sends POST /api/tasks with updated task data -> api-tasks updates data-tasks store and returns updated task.

User generates reports on /reports page -> UI sends POST /api/reports/export with filters and format -> api-reporting queries data-tasks, data-compliance, data-equipment, generates report, and returns export URL or binary.
Background job runs daily -> queries data-tasks for upcoming/overdue tasks -> sends reminders via integration-notifications API -> notifications service handles delivery and retries.
Document uploads via /api/documents/upload -> api-document-management stores files securely in data-documents and returns metadata.
validationRules: Equipment POST: equipmentId (required, unique), name (required, non-empty), category (required, non-empty), maintenanceIntervalDays (required, positive integer), manuals (optional, must be valid URLs or PDFs), notes (optional, max length 1000).

MaintenanceTask POST: taskId (required), equipmentId (required, must exist), taskType (required, non-empty), scheduledDate (required, valid date), completed (required, boolean), completionDate (optional, must be present if completed=true and >= scheduledDate), notes (optional, max length 1000).

ComplianceChecklist: checklistId (required), equipmentId (required), category (required), items (required, valid JSON array of checklist items), lastUpdated (required, date), status (required, enum: 'compliant', 'non-compliant', 'pending').
Document upload: file must be PDF or accepted link format, file size limit enforced (e.g. 10MB), metadata fields required: type (manual, compliance), equipmentId (optional, must exist if provided).
API request filters: validate date ranges (start <= end), equipmentId exists if provided, status values valid (e.g. completed, pending).
Authentication: all protected API routes require valid user session/token.
Bulk import: validate each equipment entry individually, reject entire batch if critical errors found.
errorHandling: API returns 400 Bad Request with descriptive error messages for validation failures.
API returns 401 Unauthorized if authentication fails or missing.
API returns 404 Not Found if requested equipment, task, or document does not exist.
API returns 409 Conflict on concurrent updates to the same maintenance task with versioning or timestamps.
API returns 500 Internal Server Error for unexpected failures with logging and retry mechanisms where applicable.
File upload errors return 413 Payload Too Large or 415 Unsupported Media Type as appropriate.
Background job logs failures and retries sending notifications with exponential backoff.
UI displays user-friendly error messages and prompts for corrective actions.
API rate limiting and throttling to prevent abuse.
securityNotes: All API routes except /login require authentication and authorization checks.
Role-based access control to restrict equipment and task modifications to lab managers and authorized maintenance personnel.
Secure file upload handling with virus scanning and storage in protected buckets or encrypted storage.
Use HTTPS for all client-server and server-server communications.
Sanitize all inputs to prevent injection attacks.
Implement CSRF protection on state-changing API endpoints.
Audit logging for critical operations such as equipment updates, task completions, and compliance checklist changes.
Data access limited to user's institution or lab scope to prevent data leakage.
Background job credentials and notification service keys stored securely and rotated regularly.

acceptanceTests.given: A logged-in lab manager on the /equipment page
acceptanceTests.when: They submit a new equipment form with valid details and upload a PDF manual
acceptanceTests.then: The equipment is created, stored in the database, the manual is uploaded, and the equipment appears in the equipment list

acceptanceTests.given: A logged-in user on the /dashboard page
acceptanceTests.when: They filter maintenance tasks by date range and equipment category
acceptanceTests.then: The dashboard displays only the relevant tasks with correct compliance status indicators

acceptanceTests.given: A logged-in user on the /tasks page
acceptanceTests.when: They mark a maintenance task as completed with a completion date
acceptanceTests.then: The task status updates in the database and the updated status is reflected in subsequent API calls

acceptanceTests.given: A logged-in user on the /reports page
acceptanceTests.when: They generate a compliance report for selected equipment and date range in PDF format
acceptanceTests.then: The system returns a downloadable PDF report matching the selected filters

acceptanceTests.given: The daily maintenance task reminder job runs
acceptanceTests.when: There are overdue or upcoming tasks
acceptanceTests.then: Reminder notifications are sent to assigned users and failures are logged and retried

acceptanceTests.given: A user attempts to upload a non-PDF file as a manual
acceptanceTests.then: The system rejects the upload with an appropriate error message

acceptanceTests.given: Multiple users attempt to update the same maintenance task concurrently
acceptanceTests.then: The system prevents data corruption by rejecting conflicting updates and informing users

acceptanceTests.given: An unauthenticated user tries to access /equipment page or API
acceptanceTests.when: They attempt to view or modify data
acceptanceTests.then: Access is denied and they are redirected to /login or receive 401 Unauthorized
